config.name: loadOnce
config.desc: When used with {@link #url}, calls {@link #setUrl} with this value

config.name: listeners
autoScroll
config.desc: True to scroll overflow in this panel (use with {@link #fitToFrame})

config.name: fitToFrame
config.desc: True for this panel to adjust its size to fit when the region resizes  (defaults to false)

config.name: background
config.desc: True if the panel should not be activated when it is added (defaults to false)

config.name: region
config.desc: which region to put this panel on (when used with xtype constructors)

config.name: content
config.desc: Raw content to fill content panel with (uses setContent on construction.)

config.name: autoCreate
config.desc: True to auto generate the DOM element for this panel, or a {@link Roo.DomHelper} config of the element to create

config.name: fitContainer
config.desc: When using {@link #fitToFrame} and {@link #resizeEl}, you can also fit the parent container  (defaults to false)

config.name: closable
config.desc: True if the panel can be closed/removed

config.name: params
config.desc: When used with {@link #url}, calls {@link #setUrl} with this value

config.name: adjustments
config.desc: Values to add to the width/height when doing a {@link #fitToFrame} (default is [0, 0])

config.name: resizeEl
config.desc: An element to resize if {@link #fitToFrame} is true (instead of this panel's element)

methods.name: refresh
methods.desc:
Force a content refresh from the URL specified in the {@link #setUrl} method.
  Will fail silently if the {@link #setUrl} method has not been called.
  This does not activate the panel, just updates its content.

methods.name: getUpdateManager
methods.desc: Get the {@link Roo.UpdateManager} for this panel. Enables you to perform Ajax updates.

methods.name: getChildContainer

params.name: cfg
params.desc: Xtype definition of item to add.

methods.name: getToolbar
methods.desc: Returns the toolbar for this Panel if one was configured.

methods.name: setTitle
methods.desc: Set this panel's title

methods.name: setUrl
methods.desc: Set a URL to be used to load the content for this panel. When this panel is activated, the content will be loaded from that URL.

params.name: url
params.desc: The URL to load the content from or a function to call to get the URL

params.name: params
params.desc: (optional) The string params for the update call or an object of the params. See {@link Roo.UpdateManager#update} for more details. (Defaults to null)

params.name: loadOnce
params.desc: (optional) Whether to only load the content once. If this is false it makes the Ajax call every time this panel is activated. (Defaults to false)

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns this panel's element - used by regiosn to add.

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc: Destroys this panel

methods.name: load
methods.desc: Loads this content panel immediately with content from XHR. Note: to delay loading until the panel is activated, use {@link #setUrl}.

params.name: url
params.desc:
The url for this request or a function to call to get the url or a config object containing any of the following options: 

panel.load({
    url: "your-url.php",
    params: {param1: "foo", param2: "bar"}, // or a URL encoded string
    callback: yourFunction,
    scope: yourObject, //(optional scope)
    discardUrl: false,
    nocache: false,
    text: "Loading...",
    timeout: 30,
    scripts: false
});
The only required property is url. The optional properties nocache, text and scripts are shorthand for disableCaching, indicatorText and loadScripts and are used to set their associated property on this panel UpdateManager instance.

params.name: params
params.desc: (optional) The parameters to pass as either a URL encoded string "param1=1&param2=2" or an object {param1: 1, param2: 2}

params.name: callback
params.desc: (optional) Callback when transaction is complete -- called with signature (oElement, bSuccess, oResponse)

params.name: discardUrl
params.desc: (optional) By default when you execute an update the defaultUrl is changed to the last used URL. If true, it will not store the URL.

methods.name: getTitle
methods.desc: Returns this panel's title

methods.name: isClosable
methods.desc: Returns true is this panel was configured to be closable

methods.name: getId
methods.desc: Returns this panel's id

methods.name: setContent
methods.desc: Updates this panel's element

params.name: content
params.desc: The new content

params.name: loadScripts
params.desc: (optional) true to look for and process scripts

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to release

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to capture

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: *activate
events.desc: Fires when this panel is activated.

events.name: *resize
events.desc: Fires when this panel is resized if fitToFrame is true.

params.name: width
params.desc: The width after any component adjustments

params.name: height
params.desc: The height after any component adjustments

events.name: *deactivate
events.desc: Fires when this panel is activated.

events.name: *render
events.desc: Fires when this tab is created
